metadata.feature_description: Monitors and reports Active Directory connection status and availability

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: AD settings page should load with configuration options
steps.actual: AD settings page loaded successfully showing Root Domain, User Name, Password and other configuration fields

steps.action: Clicked 'Update Authentication Settings' to trigger network status check
steps.expected: Network status should be displayed showing connection status for AD components
steps.actual: Network Status displayed showing: Accessing Global Catalog: FAIL, Checking Root Domain: FAIL, Accessing LDAP: FAIL, Find all domains in network: Could not access LDAP to obtain domains info

steps.action: Reviewed the Network Status display after updating settings
steps.expected: Global Catalog status should be clearly displayed
steps.actual: Global Catalog status is displayed as 'Accessing Global Catalog: FAIL' indicating the system correctly reports when Global Catalog is not accessible

steps.action: Reviewed the Network Status display for LDAP status
steps.expected: LDAP status should be clearly displayed
steps.actual: LDAP status is displayed as 'Accessing LDAP: FAIL' indicating the system correctly reports LDAP accessibility status

steps.action: Reviewed the Network Status display for Root Domain status
steps.expected: Root Domain status should be clearly displayed
steps.actual: Root Domain status is displayed as 'Checking Root Domain: FAIL' indicating the system correctly reports domain controller accessibility

steps.action: Reviewed the Network Status display for Network Domains status
steps.expected: Network Domains status should be clearly displayed with appropriate error message
steps.actual: Network Domains status is displayed as 'Find all domains in network: Could not access LDAP to obtain domains info' - showing appropriate error message when domains cannot be enumerated

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify status updates after configuration changes

steps.expected: Network status should refresh and display updated connection information
steps.actual: Network status was refreshed and displayed at the top of the settings page in a prominent red banner showing all four status indicators (Global Catalog, Root Domain, LDAP, Network Domains)

steps.action: Attempted to test with valid AD connection
steps.expected: Status should show OK for all components when connected to a valid AD
steps.actual: Could not test - no Active Directory domain controller is available in the test environment. The configured domain 'newdomain.corp.local' is not accessible.

issues: No Active Directory environment available for testing valid connection scenario

observations: The Network Status Monitoring feature correctly displays status for four key AD components: Global Catalog, Root Domain, LDAP, and Network Domains
Status display uses a prominent red banner to show FAIL states, making it easy to identify connection issues
The status is refreshed when clicking 'Update Authentication Settings' button
Error messages are descriptive (e.g., 'Could not access LDAP to obtain domains info')
Code review confirms the GetNetworkStatus() method in ADSIProvider.cs implements the status checking logic for all four components
Cannot test valid AD connection scenario as no real Active Directory environment is configured in the test system
